definition: to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: We thought up pet names for each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们为彼此想出了宠物的名字。

sentences.english: Simon racked his brain. Then he had an idea.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙绞尽了脑汁，终于想出了一个好办法。

sentences.english: To come up with more creative and innovative designs?
sentences.chinese: 还是想出更原创性和革新性的设计？

sentences.english: Mr Mitarai has come up with a different management model.
sentences.chinese: 御手洗先生想出了一个不同的管理模式。

sentences.english: They have worked out the stratagem to attack the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经想出了攻击敌人的策略。

sentences.english: He finally worked out a face-saving arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 他终于想出了一个保全面子的办法。

sentences.english: Madge : My brother finally figured out a way to save his money.
sentences.chinese: 我哥哥终于想出了把他的钱省下来的办法。

sentences.english: At last the old Fox thought up a way to catch the little Red Hen.
sentences.chinese: 终于，老狐狸想出了一条抓小红母鸡的妙计。

sentences.english: A good idea just leapt into my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我突然想出了一个好主意。

sentences.english: Professor Fang worked out a method to destroy bacteria on the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 方教授想出了一个办法来消灭种子上的细菌。

sentences.english: It was at this moment that Mr. Budd had his Great Idea.
sentences.chinese: 就是在这一刻，巴德先生想出了他的妙计。

sentences.english: Does she have the imagination to figure out what happened?
sentences.chinese: 她真的富有想像力，能够推想出发生的事情吗？

sentences.english: Designed for people who come up with great ideas in the shower.
sentences.chinese: 专为那些能在洗澡间想出好主意的人士设计。

sentences.english: Later, I'm inspired by toothpicks extinguishers, finally came up with a good way.
sentences.chinese: 后来，我受牙签筒的启发，总算想出了一个好的法子。

sentences.english: I have thought out a way to get over the difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 我已经想出了一个克服困难的办法。

sentences.english: Maverick could not explain how he made up the word.
sentences.chinese: 马弗里克也无法解释他是如何想出了这个词。

definition: a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
